ns0:entry.ns0:title: Criticality and marginal stability of the shear jamming transition of frictionless soft spheres
ns0:entry.ns0:summary: We study numerically the critical behavior and marginal stability of the shear jamming transition for frictionless soft spheres, observed to occur over a finite range of densities, associated with isotropic jamming for densities above the minimum jamming (J-point) density. Several quantities are shown to scale near the shear jamming point in the same way as the isotropic jamming point. We compute the exponents associated with the small force distribution and the interparticle gap distribution,and show that the corresponding exponents are consistent with the marginal stability condition observed for isotropic jamming, and with predictions of the mean field theory of jamming in hard spheres.
